title: Juan de Jongh
text:
Juan Leon de Jongh (born 15 April 1988) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He was one of the stars of Vodacom WP's ABSA Currie Cup campaign in 2009 and he made his debut against the . He became the first choice <a href="rugby%20union/centre">inside centre</a> for the <a href="Stormers">Stormers</a> in the <a href="2010%20Super%2014%20season">2010 Super 14 season</a> after the departure of stalwart and captain, <a href="Jean%20de%20Villiers">Jean de Villiers</a>. He won his first international cap against <a href="Welsh%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> on 5 June 2010, during this game he also scored his first international try with a scything break through the Welsh midfield, similar to that of his previous try against the Waratahs in the Super 14 semi-final.
He was a member of the South African Sevens team that won a bronze medal at the <a href="Rugby%20sevens%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a>. In May 2017 it was announced he would be joining Aviva Premiership side Wasps for the 2017/18 season.
2016 Summer Olympics.
De Jongh was included in a 12-man squad for the <a href="Rugby%20sevens%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>. He was named in the starting line-up for their first match in Group B of the competition against <a href="Spain%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Spain</a>, with South Africa winning the match 24–0.
